data.title: Businesses Can Find Hacker Vulnerabilities With Free Testing Service
data.meta_description: Mercury Interactive, a Sunnyvale, CA provider of Internet application testing solutions, announced a free trial offer of its ActiveTest hosted e-load...
data.text:
Mercury Interactive Corporation, a Sunnyvale, CA provider of Internet application testing solutions, announced a free trial offer of its ActiveTest hosted e-load testing service. The ActiveTest "Test Your Limits" free offer provides users with a stress test on a Web site infrastructure which can help identify the limitations and vulnerabilities of an application.

The offer can be used to help safeguard Web sites against hacker attacks such as those experienced by leading Internet companies this week. The free trial offer can also be utilized by organizations that want to improve end user 'quality of experience' by identifying bottlenecks and capacity constraints that can impede Web site performance.

Companies can sign up immediately for a "Test Your Limits" load test run at http://testyourlimits.merc-int.com, or by calling Mercury Interactive at 1-800-TEST-911. The offer expires March 31st 2000.

ActiveTest, is a fully hosted, web-based load testing service powered by Mercury Interactive's LoadRunner, a load testing tool. ActiveTest can help companies prepare against such scenarios as a 'denial-of-service' attack experienced by top Internet sites such as Yahoo! and Ebay, for example.
